<p style="color: green; font-size: 1.4em; font-weight: bold;">
General Information About Addis Ababa and Visa Information
</p>

<p style="color: black; font-size: 1.3em; font-weight: bold;">
Traveling to Addis Ababa for the First Time?
</p>

Travel experts consider Addis Ababa a vibrant and important destination in Africa. It is a city rich in history, culture, and innovation, home to world-class museums like the National Museum of Ethiopia, the African Union headquarters, and bustling traditional markets like Merkato. Visitors to Addis Ababa will experience its unique blend of tradition and modernity, diverse cuisine, and warm hospitality.

---

<p style="color: red; font-size: 1.4em; font-weight: bold;">
Steps for Visa Application to Ethiopia
</p>

<p style="color: blue; font-size: 1.3em; font-weight: bold;">
Step 1: Conference Registration
</p>

Start by registering for the conference and retain a copy of your payment confirmation and registration. When registering, make sure to indicate if you require a visa invitation letter, which will be provided by the conference organizers.

<p style="color: blue; font-size: 1.3em; font-weight: bold;">
Step 2: Hotel Accommodations
</p>

Book your hotel through the conference rooming block at designated hotels in Addis Ababa. This will offer you the best rates and serve as additional proof of your legitimate travel purpose.  
ðŸ‘‰ [hotel information](hotel.qmd)

<p style="color: blue; font-size: 1.3em; font-weight: bold;">
Step 3: Flight Arrangements
</p>

Book your flight early, ideally after submitting your visa application.

<p style="color: blue; font-size: 1.3em; font-weight: bold;">
Step 4: Ethiopian Visa Application
</p>

Most travelers will need a visa to enter Ethiopia.  
You can apply:

- Online through the official E-Visa Portal: [https://www.evisa.gov.et/](https://www.evisa.gov.et/)
- Or through the nearest Ethiopian Embassy or Consulate in your country.

Typically, you will apply for a **Conference Visa (CV)** or a **Tourist Visa (TV)** depending on your planned activities. Processing times may vary, so apply well in advance.

---

<p style="color: red; font-size: 1.4em; font-weight: bold;">
Important Information About Ethiopian Visa Applications
</p>

<p style="color: black; font-size: 1.3em; font-weight: bold;">
What is an Ethiopian Visa?
</p>

A visa is an official authorization placed in your passport that allows you to enter Ethiopia. Travelers from many countries can now apply for an E-Visa online.

<p style="color: black; font-size: 1.3em; font-weight: bold;">
Visa-Free and Visa-on-Arrival
</p>

Citizens of some nations and diplomatic passport holders may be exempt from requiring a visa. Otherwise, most international travelers must obtain a visa either online or prior to arrival.

<p style="color: black; font-size: 1.3em; font-weight: bold;">
Electronic Visa (E-Visa)
</p>

Ethiopiaâ€™s E-Visa is available to citizens of many countries and is strongly recommended for ease of travel.  
ðŸ‘‰ [Apply through the official Ethiopian E-Visa Portal](https://www.evisa.gov.et/)

<p style="color: black; font-size: 1.3em; font-weight: bold;">
Types of Visas
</p>

- **Conference Visa (CV):** For those attending the conference specifically.
- **Tourist Visa (TV):** If you also plan sightseeing in Ethiopia after the conference.

---

<p style="color: red; font-size: 1.4em; font-weight: bold;">
Required Documents for Visa Application
</p>

Be prepared to provide:

- A letter of invitation from the conference organizers (if requested).
- Proof of registration and payment for the conference.
- Hotel booking confirmation.
- Flight reservation (matching the name in your passport).

<p style="color: blue; font-size: 1.0em; font-weight: bold;">
Important:
</p>
Make sure that the name on your visa application exactly matches the name on your passport, as discrepancies can cause delays.

---

<p style="color: red; font-size: 1.4em; font-weight: bold;">
Additional Notes
</p>

- Ethiopian immigration officers reserve the right to permit or deny entry upon arrival.
- Upon arrival, you will go through Customs and Immigration at Bole International Airport in Addis Ababa.
- Always carry a printed copy of your visa approval and invitation letter when traveling.
- The conference organizers cannot intervene in individual visa applications or expedite processing.
